trustfund:
TF021426-STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT PROGRAM - BENIN,TF020789-THIRD STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT
            CREDIT TO REPULBIC OF BENIN,TF020039-DENMARK - BENIN SAL III

abstracts.cdata!:
This project is rated as marginally
            satisfactory. Much remains to be done to improve the
            business environment and attract private investors. The
            economy is highly vulnerable to external shocks and even
            more dependent on cotton than it was before the reform
            program was initiated. Poorly implemented changes in the
            sector have compromised the 1998-99 crop year, and made more
            difficult the implementation of a reform process aimed at
            empowering producers. Poor management in the energy sector
            aggravated a power shortage in 1998, due to a drought in the
            region. Despite increased budget allocations to priority
            sectors, the delivery of essential services has not
            significantly improved. Implementation of ongoing projects
            in education, health, and transport in support of this
            objective is far behind schedule. The changes supported by
            the project are likely to be sustained. Both World Bank and
            Borrower performances are rated satisfactory. Lessons
            learned include the following: A two-tranche operation was
            not the most appropriate instrument in a difficult political
            environment. A series of single-tranche operations would
            have increased leverage and flexibility. Staff continuity on
            both sides contributed to a good quality dialogue, even when
            the political environment was not conducive to reform. An
            attempt should have been made to quantify the program's
            objectives, and a monitoring and evaluation system should
            have been put in place.
